quest.name: Under Wraps
journal:
Kabuto is ready to depart.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

Kabuto approaches you in hushed tones about his first expedition. When he fails to state anything beyond the obvious─that they will soon be departing─Tsukumo takes it upon himself to better inform you of their plan. As he tells it, they recently received word of a promising addition to the vault somewhere near Namai in Yanxia. With no other leads, Tsukumo skips away with Kabuto in tow.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You speak with a villager in Namai who tells you of a Namazu sneaking about the Glittering Basin with what people assume to be treasure. Though Tsukumo believes your time would be better spent learning more about the Namazu, Kabuto insists on commencing a search for this elusive figure so as not to waste any more of your time. Tsukumo is equal parts surprised and impressed by this sudden assertiveness and eventually concedes. Your next course of action is decided, and so you make for the Glittering Basin.

You find Kabuto overlooking the basin from an ideal vantage point. As he checks the north, you begin a survey of the south when a curious shape comes into view. No sooner do you realize the figure is a Namazu than it darts back out of sight.

Along the shoreline you discover not only the Namazu, but the treasure it carefully guards: a vase. Before you can approach, however, the Namazu is confronted by a band of Red Kojin. Tsukumo and Kabuto waste no time in rushing down to save both the Namazu and its treasure.

By the time you arrive, the vase is already in the clutches of the Red Kojin. When Kabuto refuses to back down, they choose to flee rather than fight. Kabuto gives chase, but he will likely need your help when he catches up with them.

You find Kabuto to the north, three Red Kojin fallen at his feet. Despite Hirumaki making off with the vase, Gyokei is oddly relieved. As he explains it, the vase was cursed to bring misfortune to its owner, and he was hard-pressed to find a way to break the curse or dispose of it. Gyokei readily agrees to become a trading partner with the Blue Kojin, and offers a chime from his storehouse as a token of good faith. Kabuto and Tsukumo then return to Tamamizu for a well-earned rest.

Thanks to your efforts, the vault of Tamamizu has gained a treasure and the Blue Kojin a trading partner. While Kabuto thinks little of the part he has played thus far, Tsukumo has every confidence that he will lead his band of treasure seekers to ever greater riches.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “A Silence in Three Parts.”

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Good. You are here. We are preparing to embark on a search for treasure.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: <cough> Would you...erm...

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: I was certain he would follow through, but alas. He wishes to invite you on our expedition, but perhaps we should begin by explaining where we are going, and why.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Shikitahe's pirate associates in Yanxia have informed him of a treasure that may prove suitable for our vault.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: If what we have been told is true, the owner of said treasure can be found somewhere near Namai. Our mission is to befriend this individual and see if there is aught we can do to trade for this oddity, whatever it may be. Now, let us be off!

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: There you are. While waiting for you to arrive we took it upon ourselves to question the villagers. This gentleman was about to tell us more about the treasure we seek.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: This Kojin here tells me you are here looking for artifacts of great worth. Forgive me if I misunderstand, but what could be more valuable than a talking doll?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: This villager claims to have knowledge of what we seek.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: I can only tell you what I have heard. Whether or not there is truth to it, you must decide for yourselves.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: If I may ask, what exactly is this treasure?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: Gahhh! Ahem. Forgive me. I had forgotten it can speak. I do not mean to question your decision to come here, but I sincerely doubt any treasure you find will compare to this doll.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: That may well be true, but our aim is to create a collection. To that end we came here following the rumors of a treasure here in Namai.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: No doubt a burdensome quest if every piece must be a curiosity such as you. Sadly, I cannot say what this treasure is. Only that its owner is of the Namazu.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: How can you be certain what they possess is of any worth?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: He has been seen carrying something about the Glittering Basin with the greatest of care─but only briefly. Upon realizing he is not alone, he leaves with all haste.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERS02974
dialogue.text: He speaks with no one, and so we are left to wonder what it is he guards so dearly. If you mean to approach him, it will not be easy.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: How are we to strike a deal with such a seemingly skittish character?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We must find something the Namazu is willing to trade for.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We must find a way to trap the Namazu.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: That he might stay and consider an exchange instead of running away... Yes, an excellent idea.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Hmmm. I suppose that may work. A way to hold him still long enough to explain we mean no harm.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Then let us begin our search.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Not so fast, my friend. Even if he were to appear before us here and now, we have naught with which to barter. Our time would be better spent learning about this Namazu.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: We have already inconvenienced Forename greatly. We must not keep herhim away from herhis other duties.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Sympathy for a comrade? Well, I suppose it would be prudent to know where the Namazu can be found when we are ready to bargain. Very well. Let us find an ideal location to better survey the area.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Kabuto is surveying to the north. Would you take a look to the south and tell us if you see anything?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Still no sign of the Namazu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search your surroundings for the Namazu. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target the Namazu and inspect him with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: You've found him? Well done, Forename.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: But where is he headed? We must find a better vantage point.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: That Namazu is definitely up to something. But what?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search your surroundings once more for the Namazu. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target the Namazu and inspect him by pressing [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: He seems to be...digging?

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: This must be where he buried the treasure! At last we can see what it is he guards so dearly.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Ah, so it is a vase we are after.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: The only question remaining now is why must he act in secret? The answer may be our key to approaching him.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: The Red Kojin!? So we are not the only ones come in search of treasure.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Quickly, Kabuto, tuck me away and get down there. We have to stop them!

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: More bandits!? Oh, what a horrible, horrible day!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Stay back!

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: The Namazu is safe, but they've taken the vase! We have to get it back.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: (-Nervous Namazu-)Please, please, just leave me alone.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: No need to fear, friend. We are here to help.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: (-Cruel Kojin-)You hear that? The bungling Blue and his wet nurse want to help.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: (-Colossal Kojin-)No need to worry your pretty little shell. We've only come to retrieve what is by rights ours, and he was more than willing to give it to us.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: (-Nervous Namazu-)Give it to you!? You're a liar, and I still have the lumps to prove it!

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: (-Nervous Namazu-)You're here to help, yes, yes? Then you can start by teaching those brutes a lesson.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: (-Cruel Kojin-)This treasure belongs in the vault, you know this to be true. Now stand down.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: ...No. Give back the vase.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: (-Cruel Kojin-)Ho, how curious! Before he spoke as a whining child, but now he speaks as a would-be warrior?

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: (-Cruel Kojin-)Lay down your sword and surrender. If you do, we may consider allowing you to work as one of our mercenaries.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I...I would rather die than serve you Red brutes!

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: (-Colossal Kojin-)Watch your tongue! You stand in the presence of General Hirumaki of the Red!

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: Now, now, Shaugi. Let's not be rash with this would-be warrior. Given the right incentive, I'm sure he and his brothers could be convinced to join us.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Never. Not for all the treasure in the world!

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: Ugh. Again with your whining. Perhaps the Blue are not worth having as mercenaries after all.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: Though I could be convinced. Mark my words: when next we meet, I will have you on your knees begging to join us.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Those fiends! Do they think we will let them simply walk away?

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: (-Nervous Namazu-)That doll! It─it talks!

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Yes, well, though your Kojin savior here is indeed brave, he is not the best with words. I step in on occasion to speak on his behalf.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: But enough of that. Kabuto, you must follow them! Forename and I will be right behind you.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: A doll that speaks? Interesting.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Thank you for saving me. Would that we had met on better terms. My name is Gyokei.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Forename, go and assist Kabuto. I will be along shortly with our new friend here.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: I fear Harumaki may be too much for Kabuto on his own. Go quickly and help him.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: No need to worry. Your doll is safe with me. Yes, yes, very safe.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: He had reinforcements lying in wait. I managed to fend them off, but he got away.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> ...There you are!

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: What of the vase? Were you able to take it back from them?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: ...My apologies, Tsukumo.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: No need to concern yourself. No, no. I'm actually glad to be rid of it.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: As Gyokei tells it, there is a rather unpleasant story behind that vase.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Indeed there is. It was not until after I came into possession of it that I learned of the misfortune that befell each of its previous owners.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: When the birds first began to follow me, I thought nothing of it─but then their droppings came. Every day, a torrent, a maelstrom of dung from the heavens! I grew suspicious, and soon after I learned the vase had been cursed by its maker.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: I made every effort, took every opportunity to get rid of it, but whether I dropped it into the ocean or abandoned it on a mountainside, it always found its way back to me. As did the storms...

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Eventually I learned of a way the curse may be broken. It involves a small ritual which must be performed while alone. Otherwise the misfortune would spread, and we mustn't have that. No, no.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: But if the Red Kojin want it they can have it!

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: I see. Truly the world is full of strange treasures. In any case, I suspect the curse will soon come to an end.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: They will be taking the vase to the Kojin's treasure vault on the Isle of Zekki. Once enshrined within, it will be purified by the myriad kami inside. The vase will haunt you no longer.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Oh, thank goodness. I must repay you for your kindness. Come, come. If there is anything you would ask of me, name it.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Any thoughts, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Let Kabuto decide.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I only ask for your friendship on behalf of the Kojin.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: How modest of you. Well, go on Kabuto. The decision is yours.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Well, the Blue Kojin are seeking allies, and...erm...

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: What a noble gesture, putting the needs of the Kojin before yourself.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: But of course! You are mostly merchants and traders, yes, yes? That suits my plans perfectly. I was looking for partners with whom to do business.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Forgive me for interrupting, but I could not help but notice you have quite the charm.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: What!? I-I'm flattered, truly. But I don't think it would work between a Namazu and─

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: It is old, but it has an exquisite shine. Yes, that is indeed a marvelous chime that dangles about your neck.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Oh, my chime? Of course, of course! What else could you have meant.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Ahem. You have a good eye, Tsukumo. These chimes are the pride and joy of the Namazu. Why, I've worn this one about my neck since my first nameday.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: With a brilliant shine matched only by that of your kind-hearted soul, no doubt.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Please, stop, before you make me blush. Tell you what. As a show of good faith between soon-to-be partners in trade, how would you like one of these chimes?

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Not mine, of course, but I'm certain I can find one for you.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: That would be wonderful.

dialogue.name: GYOKEI
dialogue.text: Then I'm off to check my storehouse. When I find one, I will send it to Tamamizu posthaste.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: That went rather well, would you not agree? With Gyokei safe and a splendid chime promised to our vault, I believe our work here is done. Let us return to Tamamizu for a well-earned respite.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Despite our success, Kabuto seems surprisingly downcast. He won't speak to me, but perhaps you can break his silence.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Bunchin was overjoyed to hear of our new trade partner in Gyokei. It would seem we are off to a spectacular start.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Thank you for your help.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: I would say you more than helped, my friend. We would still be in Yanxia if not for your sharp eyes. In contrast, what would you say of Kabuto's performance this day?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: He brought honor to the Blue Kojin.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: Indeed he has. Though Hirumaki escaped, Gyokei's life was spared and soon our treasure vault will benefit from his generosity.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: You seem displeased. I will concede he did fail to apprehend Hirumaki, but he saved Gyokei's life, and we have gained a new trading partner. Surely that is commendable, no?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I have much to learn. The difference in strength between Forename and me is still too great.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: To acknowledge your limitations is the first step in overcoming them. Others may think you proud, but I can see there is more to you than that.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: You care deeply for the well-being of your people, though you have had few opportunities to demonstrate this. You have great potential, Kabuto, and I believe you may yet make a fine leader.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gyokei is now a trading partner with the Blue Kojin, and has pledged a contribution to the treasure vault.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Trusted reputation with the Kojin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Kojin tribal daily quests are now available from Zukin at Tamamizu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from Zukin as a reputation bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for tribal quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from Zukin. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to a wider selection of wares from Shikitahe.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake the next tribal main quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Here There Be Xaela.”
